title: Denny McCarthy
text:
Denny McCarthy (born March 4, 1993) is an American <a href="professional%20golfer">professional golfer</a>.
Amateur career.
McCarthy was born in <a href="Takoma%20Park%2C%20Maryland">Takoma Park, Maryland</a>. He played competitively on the junior golf circuit beginning at the age of 10, finding a lot of success on the MAPGA junior tour.<a href="https%3A//www.bluegolf.com/a/%23/players/player/dmccarthy6"></a> He played varsity golf and basketball at <a href="Georgetown%20Preparatory%20School">Georgetown Preparatory School</a>. He played college golf at the <a href="University%20of%20Virginia">University of Virginia</a> where he was a two-time <a href="All-American">All-American</a>.
McCarthy played on the 2010 <a href="Junior%20Ryder%20Cup">Junior Ryder Cup</a> team along with <a href="Jordan%20Spieth">Jordan Spieth</a>, <a href="Justin%20Thomas">Justin Thomas</a>, and <a href="Ollie%20Schniederjans">Ollie Schniederjans</a>.
While he was a senior at UVA, McCarthy led the United States to victory in the 2014 World Amateur Team Championship (<a href="Eisenhower%20Trophy">Eisenhower Trophy</a>) along with <a href="Beau%20Hossler">Beau Hossler</a> and <a href="Bryson%20DeChambeau">Bryson DeChambeau</a>. He posted a final round 8-under 64 while being the only American to shoot in the 60s all four days. He finished the tournament 5th overall.
In 2015, he was selected to play on the U.S. <a href="Walker%20Cup">Walker Cup</a> team where he played team matches with his former Eisenhower Trophy teammate, Beau Hossler. His 2015 <a href="Porter%20Cup">Porter Cup</a> win and clutch play to help take home the Eisenhower Trophy earned him a spot on the team.
McCarthy won the Maryland Amateur twice (2013 and 2014) and the <a href="Maryland%20Open">Maryland Open</a> three times (2010, 2013, and 2015). 
McCarthy finished tied for 42nd at the <a href="2015%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">2015 U.S. Open</a>.
Professional career.
After playing in the 2015 Walker Cup, McCarthy turned pro and played on the Web.com Tour for the 2016 season. He finished the 2016 season with seven top-25 finishes including two top-10s in 21 events. He finished the year outside the top-25 and would remain on the Web.com Tour for the following season. In 2017, he finished with nine top-25 finishes including four top-10s in 22 events. After finishing outside the top-25 in the regular season, he locked up his PGA Tour card in the <a href="Web.com%20Tour%20Finals">Web.com Tour Finals</a>.
Personal life.
McCarthy has a brother and two sisters. Ryan played college golf at <a href="Loyola%20University%20Maryland">Loyola University Maryland</a> and Cristina played college lacrosse at <a href="James%20Madison%20University">James Madison University</a> and <a href="Georgetown%20University">Georgetown University</a>.
Amateur wins.
